page.title: 06The Cemetery at Upton
page.content: The cemetery at Upton belongs to the Borough Council.It was founded in 1910. There are 130 headstones made out of marble,stone and granite. The oldest stone we found belonged to Mary Ann Diamond who died in 1911. The newest grave belongs to Winifred Sutton who died in 1982.She was the grandmother of Steven Field in our class.The headstone is made out of marble. Growing in the grass is a rare crop of{orchids,}they are Common Spotted, Early Purple and Green Winged. These orchids grow naturally here but the grass is cut at times which will allow them to flourish.
